title: Central Bank, UCO Bank, Punjab & Sind Bank, other PSU bank stocks rally up to 4% amid reports of merger
description: PSU Banks merger news: Shares of PSU banks rose up to 4% during Monday's trading session following news that the finance ministry is drafting a strategy for the next round of mergers among public sector banks, with an announcement expected in April or May. title: AU-EU Summit zeal for political will, peace, security, and economic development
description:
LUANDA: A zeal to strengthen strategic cooperation in peace, security, good governance, economic development, and sustainable development areas heralded the 7th Summit of Heads of State and Government of the African Union (AU) and the European Union (EU) held in Luanda, Angola.

title: Angola exposed to external shocks due to heavy debt burden – UN chief
description:

title: Angola stands on the brink of an extraordinary economic and reputational moment
description: Tourism, a cornerstone of Angola’s diversification strategy, is expected to see an immediate and significant uplift. title: After G20 Engagements, Shettima Heads To Angola To Represent Tinubu At AU-EU Summit
description:
Following the conclusion of his engagements at the 20th summit of the G20 Leaders in South Africa, Vice President Kashim Shettima on Sunday departed Johannesburg, South Africa for Luanda to represent President Bola Tinubu at the AU-EU Summit in the Angolan capital.

title: Why Angola is looking beyond its borders to lead continental change
description:
As Angola marks half a century of independence, President João Lourenço takes the helm of the African Union with a program to build the “Africa We Want.”

A continental mission

title: Nigeria joins Ghana, Angola, Zambia as October inflation falls to near 4-year low
description:
Nigeria’s headline inflation rate fell for the seventh consecutive month in October 2025, dropping to 16.05%, according to the Consumer Price Index (CPI) report released by the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) on Monday.

This is the lowest reading since March 2022, down from 18.02% year-on-year ...
